cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Tropical Depression (below Category 1)
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi ESE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island, and 190 mi ESE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving northwest, forecast to skirt the northwest Bahamas and then track north-northwest along or just off the east coast of Florida before turning northward toward the U.S. Southeast coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the east-central Florida coast between Jupiter Inlet and Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet northward to the Flagler-Volusia County line, FL (includes Port Canaveral area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern and central Bahamas, east-central and northeast Florida coast, then the Georgia and Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Saturday into early Sunday along the Port Canaveral area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible at the immediate Atlantic shoreline; significant inundation not expected inside the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periodic heavy showers with storm-total rainfall around 2–4 inches could cause brief ponding and reduced visibility.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf, and rip currents in and near the port approaches.
